      public static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi[][] cardToMatrix(int id, CardSide side)

      id - the id of the card
      side - the side of the card
      Returns:
      an matrix of Ansi sequences representing the card

    • simpleCard

      public static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi[][] simpleCard(org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi.Color borderColor)
      Creates a printable matrix with the border of the given color for a simple card. Can be used as helper for printing objective cards or blank cards.
      Parameters:
      borderColor - the color of the border
      Returns:
      the card as an Ansi matrix

    • placeholderCard

      public static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi[][] placeholderCard(int n)
      Creates a card that is a placeholder for another one.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the card as an Ansi matrix

    • createBoard

      public static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi[][] createBoard(Map<Integer,Trio<Integer,CardSide,Coords>> playerCards)
      Returns a matrix of Ansi sequences that represents the board of a player.
      Parameters:
      playerCards - the cards of the player
      Returns:
      an Ansi sequence matrix

    • createBoardWithPlayability

      public static org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi[][] createBoardWithPlayability(Map<Integer,Trio<Integer,CardSide,Coords>> playerCards, Map<Integer,Coords> placeholderSlots)
      Returns a matrix of Ansi sequences that represents the board of a player with the cards possible placements highlighted.
      Parameters:
      playerCards - the cards of the player
      placeholderSlots - slots where the player can place the card
      Returns:
      an Ansi sequence matrix of the board with the available slots highlighted

    • addCardToMatrix

      public static void addCardToMatrix(org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi[][] matrix, org.fusesource.jansi.Ansi[][] card, int startingRow, int startingColumn)
      Adds the give card to an Ansi matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the Ansi matrix
      card - the card as an Ansi matrix
      startingRow - the row where to start adding the card
      startingColumn - the column where to start adding the card
